UserProfile.title: UserProfile
UserProfile.description: Represents a user profile in the EnTrans application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the UserProfile entity.

companyName.description: The name of the company the user is associated with, if applicable.

creationDate.description: The date and time the user profile was created.

TransportRequest.title: TransportRequest
TransportRequest.description: Represents a transport request made by a user.

id.description: Unique identifier for the TransportRequest entity.

origin.description: The origin location of the transport.

destination.description: The destination location of the transport.

specialRequirements.description: Any special requirements for the transport.

status.description: The status of the transport request (e.g., 'pending', 'matched', 'accepted', 'completed').

TransportOffering.title: TransportOffering
TransportOffering.description: Represents a transport offering made by a transport provider.

id.description: Unique identifier for the TransportOffering entity.

origin.description: The origin location of the transport offering.

destination.description: The destination location of the transport offering.

departureDate.description: The departure date of the transport offering.

arrivalDate.description: The arrival date of the transport offering.

capacity.description: The capacity of the transport offering (e.g., number of passengers, cargo weight).

price.description: The price of the transport offering.

vehicleDetails.description: Details about the vehicle used for the transport offering.

TransportMatch.title: TransportMatch
TransportMatch.description: Represents a match between a TransportRequest and a TransportOffering.

id.description: Unique identifier for the TransportMatch entity.

matchScore.description: The score representing the quality of the match (higher is better).

matchDate.description: The date and time the match was made.

params.name: transportOfferingId

params.name: transportMatchId

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore data structure is designed to support the EnTrans application's core features, including transport requests, offerings, and matching. It prioritizes authorization independence and clear security rules by adhering to the principles outlined in the prompt. User profiles are stored under the `/users/{userId}` path, providing clear ownership. Transport requests and offerings are stored as subcollections of user profiles (`/users/{userId}/transportRequests` and `/users/{userId}/transportOfferings`), reinforcing ownership and enabling simple security rules based on `request.auth.uid == userId`. Transport matches are stored in a top-level `/transportMatches` collection. To ensure authorization independence, the `userProfileId` of both the `TransportRequest` and `TransportOffering` are denormalized into each `TransportMatch` document. This avoids the need for complex `get()` calls in the security rules to verify ownership. This design facilitates secure list operations (QAPs) by segregating data based on ownership. Each user can only list transport requests and offerings under their own user ID, ensuring that they cannot access data they are not authorized to see. The membership map approach is not applicable here, as there is no collaborative data.
